questions.text: My identity is shaped by seeking truth, even when it’s uncomfortable.
I see myself as a protector of standards, boundaries, and vows.
I feel most myself when I’m organizing knowledge into a usable system.
I feel called to bring people into understanding, not just agreement.
Part of me believes I must take control to stay safe.
Part of me believes love must be earned through sacrifice.
Part of me would rather stand alone than risk belonging.
Part of me performs refinement so I won’t be dismissed.
I feel most aligned when I’m building something real and practical.
I make meaning through symbols, art, and emotion.
I experience intuition as a form of guidance I can’t ignore.
I keep a mental record of what I’ve survived and what it taught me.
I sometimes identify more with preparing for disaster than living now.
I protect my heart by being composed and unreadable.
I adjust myself to others so I won’t lose connection.
